page.title: 09Housing-Biddestone /Corsham
page.content: In Biddestone village and its approach roads there are appromimately 220 domestic properties, 3 of which are also commercil. Most are privately owned,many former council houses having been sold to tenants. 21 are still council owned. There are 2 small estates on the edge of the village, one of privately owned bungalows and one of houses and bungalows including council property. There are eight farms in the area. Most older houses-some dating back nearly fourhundred years, border the village green. Others edge the main routes out of the village. There is a little infilling of modern houses. In Corsham there is a council estate of about 150 houses and flats, about 50 being now owner occupied ,as well as an inn and six cottages
